channel.description: Last 10 notes on ðŸ§ My manifesto

item.title: Reader-Writer-Fit
item.description: (Like product market fit) Communication defines us as a species. Itâ€™s also your interface with every other human being in existence - in the present or future - itâ€™s your brand, so care about it.

item.title: polite
item.description: exercise extreme politeness be not only execssively polite in reaction but also in action. courtesy often means going out of your way to do things unexpectedly.

item.title: existential rite of passages
item.description: There will come a time when you will discover your parentsâ€™ character flaws. Chances are, they may still be blind to these flawsâ€¦ You may feel like your whole life would have been better had they just known better.

item.title: post-structuralism
item.description: take nothing as given be contrarian - is that really a way of thinking? finding flaws/hacks in systems becomes trivial as soon as you mentally acknowledge that they are not perfect ...

item.title: sardonic
item.description: Certain people are just sardonic. Itâ€™s interesting how some life events are powerful enough to make people sardonic.

item.title: austerity
item.description: I have a different definition of austerity. Lower threshold so that you experience Life at a greater magnitude. (kindle diagram). If you lower the threshold you increase the area of â€˜experience-able euphoriaâ€™.

item.title: bear-reality
item.description: (References a conversation I had with my high-school literature teacher, Marjan Mossamaparast) Bear reality. Donâ€™t drink. Donâ€™t do drugs. (Alcohol will be looked back on as cigarettes anyway) Reality has so much more to offer swim in cold water eat spicy chilli (get a bit high) get heartbroken run a marathon Note: but obviously, you should do these things a few times.

item.title: she was abrasive
item.description: just use the green side (of the sponge) she would say. I think that said a lot. she was quite abrasive.

item.title: focus
item.description: focus doesnâ€™t do it justice it shouldnâ€™t really be mentally taxing it should be out of your control - like a hallucination.

item.title: anxiety
item.description: richard brand the secret? honestly a) come to terms with the fact that we are all going to die the same death one day. Then come back into the real world, and transmute your anixiety into ACTION.
